description:
From French oligarchie, from Latin oligarchia, from Ancient Greek ὀλιγαρχία (oligarkhía), from ὀλίγος (olígos, “few”) + ἀρχή (arkhḗ, “rule”).
Surface analysis: olig- (“few”) +‎ -archy (“rule”, “command”).

entries.meaning: A government run by only a few, often the wealthy.
examples: The Itasca Project is just one example of existing oligarchy, and a surprisingly open one at that.

entries.meaning: Those who make up an oligarchic government.
A state ruled by such a government.
